title: An idea to remove AFK's and insta-lockers forever
body:
I've heard that Riot's current lower priority queue that is being used to punish AFK's is not working at all. What friends and players in champion select have told me is that usually after a 20 minute queue time, people are just insta-locking their role because they can't afford to wait another 20 minutes. 

This is a bad system and is punishing the players.

Why don't we have a small re-queue vote? If someone insta-locks and 4/5 of the team agree then everyone gets re-queued. Of course if you queued in a party of 4 people this option is not available. This system is for normal games by the way. I'd be happy if anyone at Riot considered my idea at all, thanks for reading!

replies.body:

"people are just insta-locking their role because they can't afford to wait another 20 minutes. "
lol, do people not realise the insta-locking makes people wanna dodge the queue though?

> for the afks and d/c i think league should have a proper way of identifying them.
> ...
> riot doesnt have the capabilities of knowing if the person afk on purpose

Two contradictory statements. Either Riot has the capabilities to determine if someone AFKed/DCed on purpose or they don't and, with current technology, there's pretty much no way to tell the difference. Besides, if there was a way to do it and Riot was using it people could just disconnect their modem or computer from it's power source and as far as Riot is aware it was unintentional.
